page.title: 06The Village Hall
page.content: Hanley Swan village hall was built in 1956 and took six months to complete. It was built as a memorial to the men of the area who were killed in the two world wars.Itcost Â£5,000 and this was collected through fund raising events like concerts,whist drives and fetes. The people of Hanley Swan and Hanley Castle felt they needed a place where they could meet together. Today many people outside the villages use the hall,this goes towardsthe running costs,(50 bookings a year).The hall serves the community daily. Two mornings a week it is used for a play_group.Not only does this help to give mums a break, but also the children get to know each other which helps when they start school. One family chose to live in Hanley Swan because of the play_group.
